00010 ORDGF4cEventDecoder::ORDGF4cEventDecoder() { fDataRecord = NULL; }
00011 
00012 void ORDGF4cEventDecoder::Swap(UInt_t* dataRecord)
00013 {
00014   // Given that there is a 16-bit buffer, we have to swap things if there has 
00015   // been a switch of endian-ness.  This means the data looks like 2143 and it 
00016   // needs to look like 1234, so we just need to swap the 16-bit words. 
00017   // The first long word has already been swapped
00018   
00019   UInt_t lengthOfBuffer = LengthOf(dataRecord);
00020   if(lengthOfBuffer<=1) return;
00021   ORUtils::Swap(dataRecord[1]);
00022   UShort_t* theShortDataRecord = (UShort_t*) (dataRecord + 2);
00023   for(size_t i=0;i<2*(lengthOfBuffer-2);i++) {
00024     ORUtils::Swap(theShortDataRecord[i]);
00025   }
00026 }
00027         
00028 bool ORDGF4cEventDecoder::SetDataRecord(UInt_t* dataRecord) 
00029 //sets fDataRecord to beginning of data record; generates vector of pointers to events, 
00030 //maps event pointers to vectors of channel pointers
00031 {
00032   fDataRecord = dataRecord;
00033   fEventPtrs.clear();
00034   fChannelPtrs.clear();
00035   fChannelNumbers.clear();
00036   fEventVector.clear();
00037   
00038 
00039   ORLog(kDebug) << "SetDataRecord(): Setting the data record..." << std::endl;
00040   if (GetBufNData() == kBufHeadLen) {
00041     //ORLog(kWarning) << "SetDataRecord(): There are 0 events in the record." << std::endl;
00042     return true;
00043   }     
00044   size_t i = 0;
00045   fEventPtrs.push_back(((UShort_t*) (fDataRecord + 2)) + kBufHeadLen);
00046   size_t length = FillChannelPtrs(i);
00047   for (size_t j=0;j<GetNChannels(i);j++) {
00048     fEventVector.push_back(std::pair<size_t, size_t>(i, j));
00049   }
00050   for(i = 1; PtrIsInDataRecord(fEventPtrs[i-1]+length, false); i++) { 
00051     fEventPtrs.push_back(fEventPtrs[i-1]+length);
00052     length = FillChannelPtrs(i);
00053     for (size_t j=0;j<GetNChannels(i);j++) {
00054       fEventVector.push_back(std::pair<size_t, size_t>(i, j));
00055     }
00056   }
00057   if(!IsValid()) {
00058     ORLog(kDebug) << "SetDataRecord(): data record is not valid" << std::endl;
00059     fEventPtrs.clear();
00060     fChannelPtrs.clear();
00061     fChannelNumbers.clear();
00062     fDataRecord = NULL;
00063     return false;
00064   }
00065   ORLog(kDebug) << "SetDataRecord(): Exiting" << std::endl;
00066   return true;
00067 }
00068 
00069 size_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::FillChannelPtrs(size_t iEvent)      
00070 //fills vector in fChannelPtrs with the channels in iEvent; fills vector in 
00071 //fChannelNumbers; returns length of iEvent 
00072 {  
00073   UShort_t ep = fEventPtrs[iEvent][0];          //first 16 bits of event header hold # of events
00074   //4 LSBs determine # of channels:
00075   size_t num = (ep & 0x1) + ((ep & 0x2) >> 1) + ((ep & 0x4) >> 2) + ((ep & 0x8) >> 3);  
00076   if(num > 4) {         //there should be 0-4 channels
00077     ORLog(kError) << "GetNChannels(): Invalid number of channels: " << num << std::endl;
00078     return 0;
00079   }
00080   UShort_t* channelData = fEventPtrs[iEvent] + kEventHeadLen;
00081   size_t chanNum;
00082   for (size_t i = 0; i < num; i++) {
00083     chanNum = 0;   //number of channels
00084     for (size_t k = 0; k <= i;) {
00085       k += ((ep >> chanNum) & 0x1);
00086       chanNum++;
00087     }
00088     fChannelNumbers[fEventPtrs[iEvent]].push_back(chanNum - 1);
00089     fChannelPtrs[fEventPtrs[iEvent]].push_back(channelData);
00090     channelData += GetChanNData(iEvent, i);
00091   }
00092   return channelData - fEventPtrs[iEvent];
00093 }

00096 //Channel functions: ******************************************************************

00098 
00099 size_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanHeadLen()    //returns channel header length
00100 {  
00101   if ( IsListModeAnyC2() ) return 4; 
00102   if ( IsListModeAnyC3() ) return 2; 
00103   if ( IsListModeAnyStdC1() ) return 9; 
00104   ORLog(kWarning) << "GetChanHeadLen(): Invalid channel header length" << std::endl; 
00105   return 0; 
00106 }
00107 
00108 UShort_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanTrigTime(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00109 //returns trigger time for current channel, unless another channel is specified
00110 { 
00111   if ( IsListModeAnyStdC1() ) return GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[1]; 
00112   return GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[0]; 
00113 }
00114 
00115 UShort_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanEnergy(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00116 {
00117   if ( IsListModeAnyStdC1() ) return ((UShort_t*)(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)))[2]; 
00118   return ((UShort_t*)(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)))[1]; 
00119 }
00120 
00121 double ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanXiaPsa(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00122 {
00123   if (IsListModeAnyStdC1()) { 
00124     return ((double)(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[3] & 0xff00 >> 8) + 
00125            ((double)(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[3] & 0xff))/256); 
00126   }
00127   if (IsListModeAnyC2()) { 
00128     return ((double)(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[2] & 0xff00 >> 8) + 
00129            ((double)(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[2] & 0xff))/256); 
00130   }
00131   ORLog(kWarning) << "GetChanXiaPsa(): Data record is in compression 3 format and "
00132                   << "does not contain an XIA PSA value" << std::endl;
00133   return 0xffff; 
00134 }
00135 
00136 UShort_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanUserPsa(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00137 {
00138   if (IsListModeAnyStdC1()) return GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[4] & 0xff00; 
00139   if (IsListModeAnyC2()) return GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[3]; 
00140   ORLog(kWarning) << "GetChanUserPsa(): Data record is in compression 3 format and " 
00141                   << "does not contain a user PSA value" << std::endl;
00142   return 0xffff; 
00143 }
00144 
00145 ULong64_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanGSLT(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00146 //returns GSLT time stamp, if available
00147 {
00148   if (IsListModeAnyStdC1()) { 
00149     return BitConcat(GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[7],
00150                      GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[6],
00151                      GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[5]); 
00152   }
00153   ORLog(kWarning) << "GetChanGSLT(): Data record is in compression 3 format and does " 
00154                   << "not contain a GSLT time stamp" << std::endl;
00155   return 0xffffffffffffffffLL;  
00156 }
00157 
00158 UShort_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetChanRealTime(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00159 //returns high word of channel real time, if available
00160 {         
00161   if (IsListModeAnyStdC1()) return GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel)[8]; 
00162   ORLog(kWarning) << "GetChanRealTime(): Data record is in compression 3 format and " 
00163                   << "does not contain the real time" << std::endl;
00164   return 0xffff;  
00165 }
00166 
00167 size_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetWaveformLen(size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00168 //returns the length of the waveform data for the current channel, unless another 
00169 //channel is specified
00170 {          
00171   if (HasWaveformData()) return GetChanNData(iEvent, iChannel) - GetChanHeadLen(); 
00172   return 0; //in case data is in C2 or C3 format
00173 }
00174 
00175 size_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::CopyWaveformData(UShort_t* waveform, size_t len, 
00176   size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00177 //copies the waveform data from a specified channel to the array pointed to by
00178 //waveform, which is of length len
00179 {
00180   size_t wflen = GetWaveformLen(iEvent, iChannel);
00181   if (wflen == 0) return 0;
00182   if ((len < wflen) || (len == 0)) {
00183     ORLog(kWarning) << "CopyWaveformData(): destination array length is " << len 
00184                     << "; waveform data length is " << GetWaveformLen(iEvent, iChannel) << std::endl;
00185   }
00186   else len = GetWaveformLen(iEvent, iChannel); 
00187   const UShort_t* waveformData = GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel) + GetChanHeadLen();
00188   memcpy(waveform,waveformData,len*sizeof(UShort_t));
00189   return len;
00190 }
00191 
00192 size_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::CopyWaveformDataDouble(double* waveform, size_t len,
00193   size_t iEvent, size_t iChannel)
00194 //copies the waveform data from a specified channel to the array pointed to by
00195 //waveform, which is of length len
00196 {
00197   size_t wflen = GetWaveformLen(iEvent, iChannel);
00198   if (wflen == 0) return 0;
00199   if ((len < wflen) || (len == 0)) {
00200     ORLog(kWarning) << "CopyWaveformData(): destination array length is " << len 
00201                     << "; waveform data length is " << GetWaveformLen(iEvent, iChannel) << std::endl;
00202   }
00203   else len = GetWaveformLen(iEvent, iChannel); 
00204   const UShort_t* waveformData = GetChannelPointer(iEvent, iChannel) + GetChanHeadLen();
00205   for (size_t i = 0; i < len; i++) waveform[i] = (double) waveformData[i];
00206   return len;
00207 }

00308 //Error checking: **********************************************************************

00310 
00311 bool ORDGF4cEventDecoder::PtrIsInDataRecord(UShort_t* ptr, bool verbose)
00312 //returns true if ptr points to a valid location within the data record
00313 {
00314   if (ptr == NULL) { 
00315     if (verbose) ORLog(kWarning) << "PtrIsInDataRecord(): pointer is NULL" << std::endl; 
00316     return false; 
00317   }
00318   if (!fEventPtrs.size()) return false; 
00319   if ((ptr < fEventPtrs[0]) || (ptr >= fEventPtrs[0] + GetBufNData() - kBufHeadLen)) {
00320     if (verbose) {
00321       ORLog(kWarning) << "PtrIsInDataRecord(): pointer is not within data record" 
00322                       << std::endl << "  The pointer is " << ptr - fEventPtrs[0] 
00323                       << " short words past the 0th event " << std::endl << "  The data record has " 
00324                       << GetBufNData() - GetChanHeadLen() << " short words past the 0th event" 
00325                       << std::endl;
00326     }
00327     return false; 
00328   }
00329   return true; 
00330 }
00331 
00332 bool ORDGF4cEventDecoder::IsValid() 
00333 { 
00334   ORLog(kDebug) << "IsValid(): starting... " << std::endl;
00335   if(IsShort(fDataRecord)) { 
00336     ORLog(kError) << "Data file is short" << std::endl; 
00337     return false;
00338   } 
00339   ORLog(kDebug) << "  Data record is not short" << std::endl;
00340   if (!IsListModeAnyStdC1() && !IsListModeAnyC2() && !IsListModeAnyC3() ) {
00341     ORLog(kError) << "The channel data is not in a valid format" << std::endl;
00342     DumpBufferHeader();
00343     return false;
00344   }
00345   ORLog(kDebug) << "  Channel data is in a valid format" << std::endl;    
00346   //check that BufNData matches file length XIA is in 16-bit!!!:  
00347   if((size_t) (2*LengthOf(fDataRecord) - 4) != (GetBufNData() + GetBufNData()%2)) {
00348     // 16-bit to 32-bit would create some padding for odd numbers of
00349     // 16-bit words, but there should always be more 32-bit words.
00350     ORLog(kError) << "2*Length of record - 4 (" << 2*LengthOf(fDataRecord) - 4 
00351                   << ") does not match length of BufNData + BufNData % 2 (" 
00352                   << GetBufNData() + GetBufNData()%2<< ")" << std::endl; 
00353     DumpBufferHeader();
00354     return false;
00355   } 
00356   ORLog(kDebug) << "  Buffer length matches file length" << std::endl;
00357   //check sum of event lengths matches buffer size:
00358   size_t length = kBufHeadLen;
00359   for (size_t i = 0; i < GetDGFNEvents(); i++) length += GetDGFEventLen(i);
00360   if(length != GetBufNData()) {
00361     ORLog(kError) << "The buffer is of length " << GetBufNData() 
00362                   << " but the sum of event lengths are of length " << length << std::endl; 
00363     DumpBufferHeader();
00364     return false; 
00365   }
00366   ORLog(kDebug) << "  Sum of event lengths matches buffer size" << std::endl;
00367   //check channel lengths + event header length equals event length for each event:
00368   for (size_t i = 0; i < GetDGFNEvents(); i++) { 
00369     length = kEventHeadLen;
00370     for (size_t k = 0; k < GetNChannels(i); k++) length += GetChanNData(i,k);
00371     if (length  != GetDGFEventLen(i)) { 
00372       ORLog(kError) << "Event " << i << " has length " << GetDGFEventLen(i) 
00373                     << " but its header + channels are of length " << length << std::endl;
00374       DumpBufferHeader();
00375       return false;
00376     }
00377   } 
00378   ORLog(kDebug) << "  Length of event header + channel lengths matches event lengths" << std::endl;
00379   ORLog(kDebug) << "Data record is valid " << std::endl;
00380   return true;  
00381 }
00382 
00383 void ORDGF4cEventDecoder::DumpBufferHeader()
00384 {
00385   
00386   ORLog(kDebug) << "Dumping Buffer Header: " << std::endl
00387     << "BufNData: " << GetBufNData() << std::endl
00388     << "BufModNum: " << GetBufModNum() << std::endl
00389     << "RunTask: " << GetRunTask() << std::endl
00390     << "BufTime: " << GetBufTime() << std::endl
00391     << "Total Events: " << GetDGFNEvents() << std::endl;
00392   
00393   if(fDataRecord)
00394   {
00395     ORLog(kDebug) << "Dumping Data Record: " << std::endl;
00396     ORLog(kDebug) << "**************************************************" << std::endl;
00397     /*for(size_t i=2;i<LengthOf(fDataRecord); i+=2)
00398     {
00399       ORLog(kDebug) << fDataRecord[i] << std::endl;
00400       ORLog(kDebug) << *((UShort_t*) (fDataRecord + i)) << " "
00401         << *((UShort_t*) (fDataRecord + i)+ 1) << std::endl; 
00402     }*/
00403     ORLog(kDebug) << "**************************************************" << std::endl;
00404   }
00405 }

00410 
00411 void ORDGF4cEventDecoder::Dump(UInt_t* dataRecord) //debugging 
00412 {
00413   size_t iChannel, iEvent;
00414   size_t len; 
00415   UShort_t* waveform; 
00416   double* waveformDouble;
00417   
00418   ORLog(kDebug) << std::endl << std::endl << "ORDGF4cEventDecoder::Dump():" << std::endl ;
00419   iChannel = 0;
00420   iEvent = 0;
00421   if(!SetDataRecord(dataRecord)) return; 
00422         ORLog(kDebug) 
00423           << "  Header functions: " << std::endl
00424           << "    Crate = " << CrateOf() << "; card = " << CardOf() << std::endl
00425           << "    The buffer is " << GetBufNData() << " words long" << std::endl
00426           << "    The module number is " << GetBufModNum() << std::endl
00427           << "    RunTask: " << GetRunTask() << " ChanHeadLen: " << GetChanHeadLen() 
00428             << std::endl
00429           << "    Run Start time: " << GetBufTime() << std::endl;
00430           
00431           ORLog(kDebug) << "  Event functions: " << std::endl     
00432           << "    Event " << iEvent << " has " << GetNChannels(iEvent) << " channels and " 
00433             << GetDGFEventLen(iEvent) << " words" << std::endl
00434           << "    The ith active channel, where i = " << iChannel << " is channel number " 
00435             << GetChannelNumber(iEvent, iChannel) << std::endl
00436           << "    Event time: " << GetDGFEventTime(iEvent) << std::endl 
00437           << "    There are " << GetDGFNEvents() << " events" << std::endl  
00438           
00439           << "  Channel functions: " << std::endl  
00440           << "    Channel " << iChannel << " in event "   
00441             << iEvent << " has " << GetChanNData(iEvent, iChannel) << " words" << std::endl  
00442           << "    Trigger time: " << GetChanTrigTime(iEvent, iChannel) << std::endl  
00443           << "    Energy: " << GetChanEnergy(iEvent,iChannel) << std::endl  
00444           << "    XIA PSA value: " << GetChanXiaPsa(iEvent,iChannel) << std::endl
00445           << "    User PSA value: " << GetChanUserPsa(iEvent,iChannel) << std::endl
00446           << "    GSLT time stamp: " << GetChanGSLT(iEvent,iChannel) << std::endl
00447           << "    Real time: " << GetChanRealTime(iEvent,iChannel) << std::endl
00448           << "    The waveform data has " << GetWaveformLen(iEvent,iChannel) 
00449             << " words" << std::endl;
00450           unsigned short wavedata[GetWaveformLen(iEvent,iChannel)];
00451           waveform = wavedata;
00452           double wavedataDouble[GetWaveformLen(iEvent,iChannel)];
00453           waveformDouble = wavedataDouble;
00454           len = GetWaveformLen(iEvent,iChannel);
00455           CopyWaveformData(waveform, len, iEvent, iChannel);
00456           CopyWaveformDataDouble(waveformDouble, len, iEvent, iChannel);
00457 
00458 }

00460 UInt_t ORDGF4cEventDecoder::GetEventWaveformPoint( size_t event, 
00461                                                    size_t waveformPoint ) 
00462 {
00463   return (UInt_t) GetWaveformDataPointer(fEventVector[event].first,
00464     fEventVector[event].second)[waveformPoint];
00465 
00466 }
